text: Madoryx oiclus is a moth of the family Sphingidae. It is known from Suriname, French Guiana and from Venezuela to Costa Rica. It has also been recorded in Paraguay, Argentina and Bolivia. == Description == The wingspan is 76–93 mm. Madoryx oiclus MHNT CUT 2010 0 37 Santa Caterina Brasil male dorsal.jpg|Male dorsal MHNT Madoryx oiclus MHNT CUT 2010 0 37 Santa Caterina Brasil male ventral.jpg|Male ventral MHNT Madoryx oiclus MHNT CUT 2010 0 37 Martinique female dorsal.jpg|Female dorsal MHNT Madoryx oiclus MHNT CUT 2010 0 37 Martinique female ventral.jpg|Female ventral MHNT == Biology == Adults are on wing year round. The larvae have been recorded feeding on Rehdera trinervis and Crescentia alata. The last instar is cream colored with dark brown and black mottling on back and sides. Pupation takes place in a dark rust brown cocoon often with incorporated leaves == Subspecies == *Madoryx oiclus oiclus (Paraguay, Argentina and Bolivia,Suriname, French Guiana and from Venezuela to Costa Rica) *Madoryx oiclus jamicensis Neidhoefer, 1968 (Jamaica)Madoryx at Funet == References == Category:Dilophonotini Category:Moths described in 1870 Category:Moths of French Guiana Category:Moths of South America Category:Taxa named by Pieter Cramer
title: Madoryx oiclus
